result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM cases 22CM612, 22CT283 called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane L. Tomlinson in court with Attorney Vanessa A Klemish. Attorney Klemish states the offer requires the defendant to obtain a valid driver's license and requests additional time for him to do so.
Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:46 AM cases 22CM612, 22CT283 called. Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Shane L. Tomlinson in court with Attorney Vanessa A Klemish. Court orders that County appointed attorney be extended and applied to 22CT283.

22CT283: Defense waives reading of the complaint and Bond is set.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/3/2022 at 1:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
